info.title: DataLakeStoreAccountManagementClient
info.description: Creates an Azure Data Lake Store account management client.

delete.description: Deletes the specified firewall rule from the specified Data Lake Store account

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource group that contains the Data Lake Store account.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: The name of the Data Lake Store account from which to delete the firewall rule.

parameters.name: firewallRuleName
parameters.description: The name of the firewall rule to delete.

get.description: Gets the specified Data Lake Store firewall rule.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource group that contains the Data Lake Store account.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: The name of the Data Lake Store account from which to get the firewall rule.

parameters.name: firewallRuleName
parameters.description: The name of the firewall rule to retrieve.

get.description: Lists the Data Lake Store firewall rules within the specified Data Lake Store account.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource group that contains the Data Lake Store account.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: The name of the Data Lake Store account from which to get the firewall rules.

put.description: Creates or updates the specified firewall rule.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource group that contains the Data Lake Store account.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: The name of the Data Lake Store account to which to add the firewall rule.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the firewall rule to create or update.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to create the create firewall rule.

put.description: Creates the specified Data Lake Store account.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource group that contains the Data Lake Store account.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Data Lake Store account to create.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to create the Data Lake Store account.

patch.description: Updates the specified Data Lake Store account information.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource group that contains the Data Lake Store account.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Data Lake Store account to update.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to update the Data Lake Store account.

delete.description: Deletes the specified Data Lake Store account.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource group that contains the Data Lake Store account.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: The name of the Data Lake Store account to delete.

get.description: Gets the specified Data Lake Store account.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource group that contains the Data Lake Store account.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: The name of the Data Lake Store account to retrieve.

get.description: Lists the Data Lake Store accounts within a specific resource group. The response includes a link to the next page of results, if any.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource group that contains the Data Lake Store account(s).

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: OData filter. Optional.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: The number of items to return. Optional.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: The number of items to skip over before returning elements. Optional.

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: OData expansion. Expand related resources in line with the retrieved resources, e.g. Categories/$expand=Products would expand Product data in line with each Category entry. Optional.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: OData Select statement. Limits the properties on each entry to just those requested, e.g. Categories?$select=CategoryName,Description. Optional.

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: OrderBy clause. One or more comma-separated expressions with an optional "asc" (the default) or "desc" depending on the order you'd like the values sorted, e.g. Categories?$orderby=CategoryName desc. Optional.

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: A Boolean value of true or false to request a count of the matching resources included with the resources in the response, e.g. Categories?$count=true. Optional.

parameters.name: $search
parameters.description: A free form search. A free-text search expression to match for whether a particular entry should be included in the feed, e.g. Categories?$search=blue OR green. Optional.

parameters.name: $format
parameters.description: The desired return format. Return the response in particular formatxii without access to request headers for standard content-type negotiation (e.g Orders?$format=json). Optional.

get.description: Lists the Data Lake Store accounts within the subscription. The response includes a link to the next page of results, if any.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: OData filter. Optional.

parameters.name: $top

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: The number of items to skip over before returning elements. Optional.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: OData Select statement. Limits the properties on each entry to just those requested, e.g. Categories?$select=CategoryName,Description. Optional.

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: OrderBy clause. One or more comma-separated expressions with an optional "asc" (the default) or "desc" depending on the order you'd like the values sorted, e.g. Categories?$orderby=CategoryName desc. Optional.

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: The Boolean value of true or false to request a count of the matching resources included with the resources in the response, e.g. Categories?$count=true. Optional.

startIpAddress.description: Gets or sets the start IP address for the firewall rule.

endIpAddress.description: Gets or sets the end IP address for the firewall rule.

FirewallRuleProperties.description: Data Lake Store firewall rule properties information

name.description: Gets or sets the firewall rule's name.

type.description: Gets the namespace and type of the firewall Rule.

id.description: Gets or sets the firewall rule's subscription ID.

location.description: Gets or sets the firewall rule's regional location.

properties.description: Gets or sets the properties of the firewall rule.

FirewallRule.description: Data Lake Store firewall rule information

value.description: Gets the results of the list operation

nextLink.description: Gets the link (url) to the next page of results.

count.description: Gets the total count of results that are available, but might not be returned in the current page.

DataLakeStoreFirewallRuleListResult.description: Data Lake Store firewall rule list information.

provisioningState.description: Gets the status of the Data Lake Store account while being provisioned.

state.description: Gets the status of the Data Lake Store account after provisioning has completed.

lastModifiedTime.description: Gets the account last modified time.

endpoint.description: Gets or sets the gateway host.

defaultGroup.description: Gets or sets the default owner group for all new folders and files created in the Data Lake Store account.

DataLakeStoreAccountProperties.description: Data Lake Store account properties information

location.description: Gets or sets the account regional location.

name.description: Gets or sets the account name.

type.description: Gets the namespace and type of the account.

tags.description: Gets or sets the value of custom properties.

properties.description: Gets or sets the Data Lake Store account properties.

value.description: Gets the results of the list operation

nextLink.description: Gets the link (url) to the next page of results.

count.description: Gets the total count of results that are available, but might not be returned in the current page.

DataLakeStoreAccountListResult.description: Data Lake Store account list information response.

code.description: Gets the HTTP status code or error code associated with this error

message.description: Gets the error message localized based on Accept-Language

target.description: Gets the target of the particular error (for example, the name of the property in error).

ErrorDetails.description: Data Lake Store error details information

trace.description: Gets the stack trace for the error

context.description: Gets the context for the error message

InnerError.description: Data Lake Store inner error information

code.description: Gets the HTTP status code or error code associated with this error

message.description: Gets the error message to display.

target.description: Gets the target of the error.

details.description: Gets the list of error details

innerError.description: Gets the inner exceptions or errors, if any

status.description: Gets the status of the AzureAsuncOperation

AzureAsyncOperationResult.description: The response body contains the status of the specified asynchronous operation, indicating whether it has succeeded, is in progress, or has failed. Note that this status is distinct from the HTTP status code returned for the Get Operation Status operation itself. If the asynchronous operation succeeded, the response body includes the HTTP status code for the successful request. If the asynchronous operation failed, the response body includes the HTTP status code for the failed request and error information regarding the failure.

SubscriptionIdParameter.name: subscriptionId
SubscriptionIdParameter.description: Gets subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.
